sn16.12:1.1: At one time Venerable Mahākassapa and Venerable Sāriputta were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.
sn16.12:1.2: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of retreat, went to Venerable Mahākassapa, and exchanged greetings with him.
sn16.12:1.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Mahākassapa:
sn16.12:1.4: “Reverend Kassapa, does a Realized One exist after death?”
sn16.12:1.5: “Reverend, this has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:1.7: “Well then, does a Realized One not exist after death?”
sn16.12:1.8: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:1.10: “Well then, does a Realized One both exist and not exist after death?”
sn16.12:1.11: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:1.13: “Well then, does a Realized One neither exist nor not exist after death?”
sn16.12:1.14: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:1.16: “And why has this not been declared by the Buddha?”
sn16.12:1.17: “Because it’s not beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. It doesn’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn16.12:1.18: That’s why it has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:2.1: “So what now has been declared by the Buddha?”
sn16.12:2.2: “‘This is suffering’ has been declared by the Buddha.
sn16.12:2.5: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’ has been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:2.6: “And why has this been declared by the Buddha?”
sn16.12:2.7: “Because it’s beneficial and relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. It leads to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn16.12:2.8: That’s why it has been declared by the Buddha.”
